content.raw:
I am now running with 4 physical cores and Val stands up without collapsing after being released from the harness.  However, shortly after being released, the head starts moving back and forth, as if the robot was saying "no."  Also, when I put in the step command, the robot takes a very high step and then falls down.  I am getting these errors during the startup:

```
#!python

localhost ncl_cpp: [ERROR   ] [gov.nasa.SharedMemorySimInterfacePlugin.findUrdfSensors] Possibly missing an api or node tag from one or more imu sensors
localhost ncl_cpp: [WARN    ] [gov.nasa.SharedMemorySimInterfacePlugin.findUrdfSensors] Imu sensor head_imu_sensor doesn't have <imuTransform> tag. It is likely that the data you receive from this sensor will be incorrect.
```

then a bit later, this error:


```
#!python

ICPBasedLinearMomentumRateOfChangeControlModule: desiredCMP contained NaN. Set it to capturePoint.
```
content.html:
I am now running with 4 physical cores and Val stands up without collapsing after being released from the harness. However, shortly after being released, the head starts moving back and forth, as if the robot was saying "no." Also, when I put in the step command, the robot takes a very high step and then falls down. I am getting these errors during the startup:

localhost ncl_cpp: [ERROR   ] [gov.nasa.SharedMemorySimInterfacePlugin.findUrdfSensors] Possibly missing an api or node tag from one or more imu sensors
localhost ncl_cpp: [WARN    ] [gov.nasa.SharedMemorySimInterfacePlugin.findUrdfSensors] Imu sensor head_imu_sensor doesn't have <imuTransform> tag. It is likely that the data you receive from this sensor will be incorrect.

then a bit later, this error:

ICPBasedLinearMomentumRateOfChangeControlModule: desiredCMP contained NaN. Set it to capturePoint.
